content:
> BTW, I am already drafting an UMIP to enshrine a gas price oracle in UMA's DVM .. which will allow DeFi to create on-chain options/futures market for gas, which will give dApp developers a way to hedge their gas subsidies.
would like to consult everyone here on the most manipulation-resistant proxy statistic for gas price in ETH terms. 

Suppose two parties want to settle an options/futures contract on the 1st of Oct 00:00 UTC. They could agree that the strike price would be:

- the median of medians of the preceding 300 blocks (~1h worth of blocks). 
Or:
- sort all tx's in the preceding 300 blocks. Sum up the gas used across all of these txns = `total_gas`. Keep a rolling sum of gas used starting from the lowest transaction until the `rolling_sum > total_gas / 2`.  Take the gas price as that of the last txn you processed. This would effectively give you the median txn gas price weighted by gas used.
